nodes.text: The ban against smoking should be approved
Those of us who work in the Health Service see every day the tragic consequences of exposure to the powerful carcinogens contained in tobacco smoke.
The link between smoking and Glasgow's ill-health is clear and compelling. Environmental tobacco smoke damages the health of every Scot from the youngest to the oldest
The goal is to reduce Glasgow's ill-health
The best means to reduce Glasgow's ill-health is to eliminare its main cause
Environmental smoke is against the fundamental rights
If something is against the fundamental rights must be abolished
A fundamental principle underlying the way we live out lives in Scotland is that people shouls be free to make choices about how they live their lives -so long as those choices do not harm others
Environmental tobacco smoking harms people without they choosing that
The damage done by cigarettes is suffered disproportionately by the poor
The prime minister is committed to narrowing health inequalities and avoiding the causes of health inequalities
if we are serious about narrowing health inequalities we must do what we can to discourage cigarette smoking and to protect the majority of Scots who choose not to smoke from damage to their health.
